content.raw:
I took a wild guess here with nice round numbers, but these `<control_joint_rad_to_cl>` values should be the total control surface deflection divide by [Lift_due_to_Elevator_Deflection](https://github.com/tridge/jsbsim/blob/master/aircraft/c172p/c172p.xml#L666).

As far as I can tell, the control surface command range for elevator is defined by [this Elevator Control block](https://github.com/tridge/jsbsim/blob/master/aircraft/c172p/c172p.xml#L245). Looks like it implies the range goes from (-0.4886 to +0.40135)?

Also, we should make it a feature request to add a `<control_joint_rad_to_cd>` using information from [Delta_drag_due_to_flap_deflection](https://github.com/tridge/jsbsim/blob/master/aircraft/c172p/c172p.xml#L464) and [Drag_due_to_Elevator_Deflection](https://github.com/tridge/jsbsim/blob/master/aircraft/c172p/c172p.xml#L522), etc.


Similarly [Pitch_moment_due_to_elevator_deflection](https://github.com/tridge/jsbsim/blob/master/aircraft/c172p/c172p.xml#L808).
content.html:
I took a wild guess here with nice round numbers, but these <control_joint_rad_to_cl> values should be the total control surface deflection divide by Lift_due_to_Elevator_Deflection.

As far as I can tell, the control surface command range for elevator is defined by this Elevator Control block. Looks like it implies the range goes from (-0.4886 to +0.40135)?

Also, we should make it a feature request to add a <control_joint_rad_to_cd> using information from Delta_drag_due_to_flap_deflection and Drag_due_to_Elevator_Deflection, etc.

Similarly Pitch_moment_due_to_elevator_deflection.
